temple.name: Anchorage, Alaska
temple.email: Log into your LDS acount to access this
temple.summary: The Anchorage, Alaska temple is the first and only temple built in Alaska.  It was dedicated on January 9-10, 1999 by Gordon B. Hinckley.  It was one of the smaller temples with only one endowment room.  After being enlarged it was rededicated on February 8, 2004.  The Celestial Room has a beautiful 700-pound chandelier featuring thousands of Hungarian crystals and 140 lights.  This temple is located in southern Anchorage just off the Seward Highway.  It is the northernmost temple of the Church.  There are no services available there so if you are visiting from out of town, make sure you bring your own temple clothing.

temple.name: Medford, Oregon
temple.email: Log into your LDS acount to access this
temple.summary: The Medford, Oregon temple was the second temple built in Oregon.  It is a beautiful temple that sits on two acres and is built out of Gray granite quarried from Mount Airy, North Carolina.  It was completed in 2000 and dedicated on 16 April 2000 by James E. Faust.  Being a smaller temple, it does not provide any services so make sure if you are attending it, you bring your own temple clothing.

temple.name: Portland, Oregon
temple.email: Log into your LDS acount to access this
temple.summary: The Portland, Oregon temple was the first temple built in Oregon.  This beautiful temple is easy to spot with its towering spires.  It has a two-story Celestial Room with a grand staircase and three chandeliers.  There is a skylight upstairs that has a wonderful view of the Angel Moroni.  It was dedicated by Gordon B. Hinckley on the 19-21 of August 1989 and sits on 7.3 acres.

temple.name: Seattle, Washington
temple.email: Log into your LDS acount to access this
temple.summary: The Seattle, Washington temple was the 19th temple built and was dedicated on 17-21 of November 1980 by Spencer W. Kimball.  It is actually located in Bellevue on a gently rising hill.  It is one of only five temples where the Angel Moroni is holding the gold plates.  The landscaping features a cascading water feature along with family-themed  statues.
